newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares ease in holiday sell-off.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares ease in holiday sell-off.

text.p: Slovenia's blue-chip SBI index eased 0.68 percent on Thursday as many share-holders sold off some of their stocks before the ascension day holiday on Friday, traders said.

"Many brokers feel better if they sell some shares before leaving on holiday. Most of the volume is accounted for by foreigners and they do not sell, so there was not much profit-taking," said Zoran Spasenic, a trader at brokerage BPH.
* The SBI index eased 0.68 percent or 11.02 points to 1,600.40.
* Preferred shares of trading firm Kovinotehna led decliners, tumbling 4.12 percent to 512 tolars on volume of 135 shares.
* Drug maker Lek was the most actively traded stock, easing 0.30 percent to 36,690 tolars on volume of 2,421 shares. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
